Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jsp

Interface JSPParser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TraditionalJSPParser, XMLJSPParser
    public interface JSPParser
    Common interface for JSP parsers that can handle both XML (JSPX) and traditional JSP syntax. Implementations parse JSP source files and create an in-memory abstract syntax tree that can be used to generate Java servlet source code.

    This interface supports two parsing modes:

    • XML Mode - Parses JSP files in XML format (JSPX) using SAX parsing
    • Traditional Mode - Parses traditional JSP syntax with <% %> scriptlets

    Both parsers create the same internal representation, enabling uniform code generation and compilation to javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet classes.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        JSPPage parse​(java.io.InputStream input,
              java.lang.String encoding,
              java.lang.String jspUri)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              JSPParseException
        Parses a JSP source file from the provided input stream and creates an abstract syntax tree representation.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream containing JSP source bytes
        encoding - the character encoding of the JSP source (e.g., "UTF-8")
        jspUri - the URI/path of the JSP file being parsed (for error reporting)
        Returns:
        a JSPPage representing the parsed JSP structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the input
        JSPParseException - if the JSP source contains syntax errors

      • parse

        default JSPPage parse​(java.io.InputStream input,
                      java.lang.String encoding,
                      java.lang.String jspUri,
                      JSPPropertyGroupResolver.ResolvedJSPProperties jspProperties)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      JSPParseException
        Parses a JSP source file from the provided input stream using the specified JSP configuration properties. This method allows parsers to respect JSP configuration such as scriptingInvalid and elIgnored settings.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream containing JSP source bytes
        encoding - the character encoding of the JSP source (e.g., "UTF-8")
        jspUri - the URI/path of the JSP file being parsed (for error reporting)
        jspProperties - the resolved JSP configuration properties
        Returns:
        a JSPPage representing the parsed JSP structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the input
        JSPParseException - if the JSP source contains syntax errors or violates configuration

      • canParse

        boolean canParse​(java.io.InputStream input,
                 java.lang.String encoding)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Determines if this parser can handle the given JSP source format.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream containing JSP source (will be reset after checking)
        encoding - the character encoding to use for format detection
        Returns:
        true if this parser can handle the format, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during format detection

      • getParserName

        java.lang.String getParserName()
        Gets a human-readable name for this parser implementation.
        Returns:
        the parser name (e.g., "XML JSP Parser" or "Traditional JSP Parser")
